review_title: Nothing short of a dumpster fire
pros: When times are good here, they’re truly good. Staff is friendly. The work done here is truly good work.
cons: Management likes to act like they get down with their staff. Some supervisors are willing, but others like to bs their job and are typically unavailable to staff who need their assistance. Nobody in this organization has received the same training. Training is all over the place and will actually give you wrong information upon actually entering into your positions. I have clients who want to love me, and do, but are so hesitant to work with our case managers because they’ve had between 5-8 case managers. My program is 6-12 months long. Clients are meeting with new case managers every few months. This organization is unprofessional and wants to deflect that onto their staff who are sick of being played.

review_title: Society of St. Vincent de Paul
pros: Helping others with their needs
cons: Low pay and low pay

pros: Creating meaningful connections with customers in the community.
cons: Work environment is highly chaotic & disorganized, bordering on emotionally unhealthy. Management enforces rules in a selective nature.

job_title: Volunteer in Bury, East of England, England
pros: Good environment , nice people
cons: Pressure all the time, manager grumpy

pros: The work is flexible and varied
cons: Some senior staff practice indirect discrimination and give impartial treatment to staff.

pros: - nice people - okay pay
cons: - rude customers sometimes - no employee discounts or anything like that

pros: Kind coworkers, fulfilling mission, somewhat flexible work arrangements, and professional development opportunities.
cons: Incredibly low pay compared to local market and considering education/experiences. They often expect people from a certain background to work there. More specifically, they encourage “mission martyrs”, hoping you’ll sacrifice free time and even pay to support the organization’s mission.

pros: The workers and supervisors are nice.
cons: I'm not entirely sure if HQ knows what they're doing.

job_title: Resident Relations Specialist in Eugene, OR
pros: The director of programs if great. They listen to mostly everything you need.
cons: They allow the managers of the programs to degrade and make us feel less than and afraid to even leave your desk without being watched.

cons: Inconsistencies in the treatment of employees.

cons: Run like a jail.LOTS OF ILLNESS dirty and racial divides. Fighting drug dealing .Dayton PD there almost daily. Plenty of shady staff and resident equally. Problems not adressed as needed and good employees are sacrificed for the old .

pros: Staff is great, job is rewarding

review_title: Low stress environment but increaing pressure on full time workers
pros: Low stress environment Sense of community
cons: Management are pushing to a model with less casuals and more volunteers, this doesn't always work out so full timers end up stuck with not enough support stuff to carry out their daily roles

job_title: Client Support Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Working with the clients and serving the homeless community. Fully paid health care through Kaiser. Overtime always available. This is for the Division Circle Navigation Center.
cons: The starting pay is low for the position considering the details of the job. This line of work is not for everybody so the turnover rate is high. However if the wage was raised the company might be able to retain staff that are committed to the job. There are constant inconsistencies from management in regards to protocol. There are no written protocols, at least none that I could find. Each shift is run completely differently which can be frustrating for clients as well as staff. One shift may be loose on some of the rules, while others are quite strict about them. All that does is lead to lack of comradery. How can we possibly work together as a team in these conditions.

review_title: A good place to complete 6 month contract
pros: Excellent range of programs for clients Experienced staff Excellent support for staff through exteral providers
cons: Understaffed No penalties paid for evening shifts A bit of a 'boys club' culture

cons: Rude customers expect discounts all the time

cons: I genuinely do not have anything bad to say about this organization

pros: Loved the customers Loved the job

pros: Autonomous role working for a great charity , great leadership team , strong moral values .
cons: Can be demanding and perceptions of what an area managers role is at store level is negative which can be very deflating and challenging when your working hard to get results . Hard to get change happening .

pros: Good pay, nice and caring colleagues, opportunities to move into different roles. I had seniors/management to call in times of need, even on the weekend. Opportunity for weekend work (weekend pay loading). Rewarding community work.
cons:
Team leaders are not actively involved in client matters, they do not reach out to you, and they can be hard to contact at times. At times management were not compassionate and turned a blind eye to family issues.
No encouragement for good outcomes or hard work completed.
There should have been more training and focus on child protection issues that occurred on-site, some safety/child issues were not addressed. More training on resident safety needed too (e.g. weapons, violent people presenting to the site). No debrief for major incidences.

pros: Employer accepts diversity, forgiving, believes in second, third chances, tries very hard to support family/life/work balance, does the best it can afford to with benefits. Strives to reward valuable performers with annual merit raises and colas.
cons: Close to minimum starting wage for most thrift store positions, serious issues as a religious charity that attempts to compromise between a spiritual ministry's devotion to Godly principles and a secular company's worldly beliefs. job_title: Outreach Specialist in New Port Richey, FL
pros: Working with Homeless Veterans and their family
cons: Nothing but backstabbing management, sneaky

job_title: Lead Processor in Mountain Home, ID
pros: It felt nice when I thought I was helping people and that the work was important
cons: Extremely unprofessional and dishonest business practices. Low pay. Backbiting in the Mountain Home store. Poor communication.  No accountability.  Lead managers don't care and don't listen. Dishonest people are rewarded. Store employees that are allowed to remain employed gossip in front of customers in a very vindictive and damaging way. Shoplifting by certain employees and their families is overlooked. I couldn't go anywhere in town without a customer who'd shopped in the store recognizing me and complaining about rude staff or asking why so and so was allowed to take anything they wanted from the store free of charge.  When the company went through several months not making good profits, their answer was to lie about employees and fire them one by one. Worse, the remaining store employees repeated these lies about these people to customers and other business owners in town. Horrible

review_title: Great job not enough hours pay to little

pros: Benefits and perks, also good people to work for
cons: Rushed pickups when you are a driver

pros: good pay , lovely staff friendly staff
cons: cant think of any cons

pros: Great employees , Fun place to work
cons: horrible management, Don’t treat employees right

review_title: Ever had a place that warmed your heart and gave you purpose?
pros: This job does that for you... I leave happy that my body hurts just so that somebody could have an outfit to help them with their next day... or help somebody find furnishings for their home they had lost in a fire... I have never had such a fulfilling job where I enjoyed the people I worked with and those whom I was helping... With no prejudices and judgement they took me in, and with no prejudices and judgement we helped everybody...
cons: When you look in the dressing rooms and find that people ripped off the price tags and stole from such a wonderful place that gives hope and helps the needy.

pros: Great benefits and awesome co workers.  Schedule flexibility. Never a dull moment. A feeling of accomplishment as you know the work you do is benefiting those in need.
cons: Management has changed from caring about people to only caring about the all mighty dollar and that is completely opposite of the intentions of St. Vincent de Paul himself. Constantly assuring us that our hard work will result in pay increases, but also constantly creating all sorts of new positions to fill. No consideration of old employees for new positions. A "out with the old, in with the new" attitude.

job_title: Retail Assistant in Perth, Western Australia
pros:
- laid back team
- discounted items, first pick for employees
- have free biscuits/ coffee tea but not substantial food
- aiding in a charitable organisation
- actually will hire a diverse group of people with different backgrounds
cons:
- some of the weirdest customers
- donations can be in poor condition, little gross to be handling
- lots of theft to deal with
- work can be quite slow, probably would drive competitive types crazy
- management barely exists but sometimes the changes higher ups make to the store are just weird and tedious
- the volunteers for the dole either work or they don't, and most don't, there can be 5 people in the store and just you and the manager are working- little reprimanding for the dole workers can become annoying

review_title: Racial Discrimination exist within this company.
job_title: Third Key in Saint Ann, MO
pros: None All third key holders are suppose to be full time  according to hand book and with Benifits but since I am Black they don't give me this option. I even asked why I wasn't entitled to benifits but got told I have to get this from other sources. I feel discriminated against and exploited.
cons: I am devasted that I even applied for this Job I never expected to be treated so degrading by my head Boss of this company. If you are Black don't go apply at the store on St. Charles Rock Rd you will be mistreated especially women. I don't understand why my Boss was put in this position I feel that he doesn't represent the values and mission of this company anytime a boss depgrated another human being very devasted and I'm even more devasted because this company caused me the loss of my unborn child. I'm being discrimated against and exploited. Nothing is being done about the loss of my unborn child I'm hurt and devasted.

pros: This experience changed my life and touched my soul forever.  This organization is filled with caring, hard working, beautiful people.  I needed a job badly when the economy tanked a few years ago.  My pocket book and my pride were broke.
cons: It was the toughest job I ever had. It can take a toll on your emotions if you are not supported.  I left mostly because I needed to make a livable wage.  Although looking back now- I usually say if I ever win the lottery I would go back and ask to work here again.

review_title: Great Company, Great Coworkers, Stupid Managers
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Eugene, OR
pros: I had a lot of fun while I was there. It was easy to help the customers and my old coworkers are the kindest friendliest people I've ever met. I did a lot of good for the community and it was very good for me to do it.
cons: The company has a terrible habit of hiring idiots for mangers. My last one was a complete psychopath. She threw temper tantrums, micromanaged us, was very angry, and grew increasingly hostile towards me. It got to the point where I started having daily anxiety attacks because of her. I had to see my doctor and get prescription medications just to keep my job.

review_title: Volunteering here can be nice but working there is MISERY
pros: Helping others, on the rare occasions you're allowed to do that.
cons: Learning how the staff treated each other, seeing the vicious politics of the organization, hearing about the way staff "really feel" about volunteers - awful. My boss bullied me and even tried to impact my church life outside of work by telling me who I could associate with at church. This same boss routinely called coworkers names behind their back. HR is a joke and basically lets you know you can take it and like it or find the door.

pros: Good hours, great people working in the stores.
cons: Executive management is exceedingly weak and overpaid.  Despite being in a store that exceeded sales and profit margin budgets two years running received no raises and bonuses seemed to be decided by throwing darts at a dart board (and were very small when awarded to boot)  Never had one evaluation in over three years of working there.  While company claims its mission is to help the poor, they don't even care about their own employees, most of whom live below the poverty level on the hours and wage rates (minimum).  Company laid off full-time associates and managers (many with 5+ years of service) with no severance pay.  Decided lack of professionalism.  If you want to work for a non-profit, you can do much better than SVDP.

job_title: Newsletter Writer in San Diego, CA
pros:
o whom it may concern March 12th , 2011
This is to inform you that Patrick Mctaggart served as a resident at St. Vincent De Pauls
During May 2009 - June 2012, while he was a student at San Diego City College. He worked with our staff to rehabilitate the homeless and the elderly in the San Diego area.
He participated in most activities associated with the project: writing solicitation, and newsletters for the residents and staff.Patrick was a conscientious worker. He was prompt and very meticulous. If we had the money in our budget we, would have offered Patrick a permanent position.
Sincerely yours. Louisa Stark
Louisa Stark
Louisa Stark
Executive Director
cons: No more money in the budget to hire me

review_title: The most rewarding experience in myprofessional life
pros: Freedom to decision make. No red tape but accountability is still present. Sharing experiences with staff and volunteers. Being able to see you can make a difference.Flexibilityto use your knowledge to train others
cons: Really there are none but if you really searched for a con perhaps the Societys lack of modern equipment

review_title: Great customers, fun job but awful management
pros: Very fast paced job, great loyal customers, basically a fun job and decent location. Dedicated employees who stick around regardless of situation.
cons: Abusive, hostile, stressful environment. Don't expect recognition of work well done, raises or benefits. Problems get thrown unde the rug with no resolution. The atmosphere will suck the joy out of you no matter how positive you are

pros: AmeriCorps really chose a fantastic position. Loved working with the clients that came through. Support from supervisors and other volunteers is valuable and helped guide me while I was getting my footing in the Organization. Flexible, allowed me to meet with organizations outside of SVdP in order to get a better understanding of my position and what the need in the area was.
cons: A lot of individual work. They put a lot of trust in you to just know what you're doing which took a while to get used to, but overall made me become more professional and creative with how I ran the program.

review_title: Low pay with expectation to go extra mile
job_title: Young Vincentian Administrator in London, England
pros: Nice team who are friendly, sociable and care about individuals and wellbeing.  Employee assistance programme. Nice working environment sharing the office with CAFOD who have social activities which SVP can participate in at lunchtime.
cons: Low pay.  Not much support as tends to be one person per role. Working overtime is common  which one can only take back as TOIL for specific reasons and is often not recompensed. The expectation is to go the extra mile.

pros:
Community--You will meet some amazing people who volunteer here.
Faith Based--You should grow in your faith just by being a part of this organization
Humility -- After seeing the situation of some of your clients you will be humbled at your own blessings
cons:
Heavy time commitment--Between home visits and meetings and fundraising there is a time commitment
"Lifers" -- Certain people will be looking to take advantage of this organization. It is sad and frustrating. But for every person who takes advantage there are those who really need help.

pros: You get to help a non-profit organization helping the public needs. Friendly, flexible hours, variety, meet new people, make new friends. There is no way to not end up buying something while working there!
cons: Standing for entire shift, need to sit and take pressure off feet and lower back occasionally.

review_title: Everyday was actually fun and it was never an issue to go into work, all of the ladies I worked with were super sweet.
pros: Everyone got along so well and was so nice to one another all the time.
cons: Sometimes when we would have huge sales there would be bins and clothes everywhere and you would constantly be picking up clothes.

review_title: I loved working at St. Vincent's In Alpena. The people who work there are welcoming, kind & super easy to get along with
pros:
Friendly work environment
Great Manager
They help the community tremendously
cons: It's a little far out of town, when I previously worked there it was in town but other than that nothing bad to say!

job_title: Store Manager in Saint Thomas, ON
pros: Rewarding to work with a fantastic team and help those in need. Benefits are very good. Always closed on Sundays.
cons: Location can leave you feeling unsafe. Having a board and store committee to answer to can be confusing and frustrating as well can be overwhelming with too many demands from too many people.

pros: Clients are the reason I love this job.
cons: Underpaid for the amount of work required, too many politics, issues brought to management seem to fall on deaf ears, undervalued, health insurance stinks for anyone with medical issues.

pros: To help the needy and feel you have helped make a difference. The volunteers. The workers on the ground floor are brilliant and caring.
cons: Made a complaint about being bullied by my manager. Found that it had been brought to senior managements attention before yet nothing done. I was moved from my position. I agreed to mediation with a written apology from my manager but was refused. Wanted to send me back without any concerns to my welfare. Was made to feel that resigning was my only way out.

pros: it is very diverse and public and catholic school come and volunteer as a part of their goal and requirements for school.
cons: Monitor the volunteers as far as daily walk ins.  Can serve more healthier food to the low income community that it predominately cater to.

pros: This no profit organization helps poor people with items they need if they don't have money.
cons: Been there 8 years, still at minimum wage, no chance for advancement financially in this organization.  I have advanced in terms of positions, I have always taken on extra duties and work hard for this organization.

review_title: Fast Paced Work Environment, Understaffed to match
pros: Lots of customer interaction and the potential to set aside items you like before they reach the store.
cons: Had lots and lots of duties for such a small role. Had to lift heavy furniture all day, in a hot room with only 1-2 coworkers dealing with 150+ cars a day in the summer. Management lacked true managerial skills.

pros: Incredible benefits, competitive pay, plenty to do, reasonably flexible schedule, growth opportunities, and a feeling of doing something for the community.
cons: Hours can be long, policies can be inconsistent even on a store by store basis, some managers are not the best at communication.

pros: Up to 60% of wage paid into tax free account of desired. Workplace training and advancement available. Paid holiday leave and sick leave.
cons:
Lower wage than comparable government positions. Limited government funding affects availability of necessary resources.
Cramped office space compared to client areas.

pros: They do good work helping the poor. They provide job training and job opportunities. They help with funds for emergencies.
cons: They pay the unskilled labor almost as much as the college grads. They don't give raises very often. They don't appreciate the workers much and expect one person to do the work of two people.

pros: some people who donate and Volunteer do care and are fun to be around
cons: management has a bad attitude and often takes advantage of the fact that this is a charity. Vacation/sick pay is a joke because you often cant take it without going through third degree about why. Raises are nonexistent and good employees usually leave over pay or management igo trips. They cant retain good talent and usually stuck with those who are there for money.

pros:
- My co-workers are pretty friendly and helpful. 
- Managers are good, too.
- Flexible retail hours but within the shop's current needs.
- Good retail experience, different tasks to do.
cons:
-  I cannot see any career opportunities here, just volunteering.
- Some customers are a bit rude.

review_title: Madison, WI Excellent place to work!
pros: Great pay and benefits, work with wonderful people for a cause greater than standard retail. Food pantries and shelters benefit from sales. Room for advancement.
cons: Heavy lifting required in furniture department, but not required of all employees. Thrift store environment.

review_title: Very tense and bad behaving people but otherwise it is rewarding for me at times

cons: I get alot of food service training

pros: Good work ethics, hardly ever had to deal with difficult customers, nice vibes and lovely workers.

pros: Work with wonderful people, help those in need.
cons: Work in a very unChristian environment.  Expects too many hours from exempt employees.

pros: Being able to help the sick and homeless get the necessary medicine they need. Translating in French and Spanish to clients that speak little or no English. Learning about the pharmaceutical trade.
cons: Some clients are impatient and hostile when they do not receive their medicine promptly.

pros: it is fairly easy work and are able to work at your own pace. most positions specify require no experience is required
